verses.text: O God, thou artmy God; early will I seek thee: My soul thirsteth for thee, My flesh longeth for thee, In a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;
To see thy power and thy glory, So asI have seen thee in the sanctuary.
Because thy lovingkindness isbetter than life, My lips shall praise thee.
Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.
My soul shall be satisfied as withmarrow and fatness; And my mouth shall praise thee withjoyful lips:
When I remember thee upon my bed, Andmeditate on thee in the nightwatches.
Because thou hast been my help, Therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
My soul followeth hard after thee: Thy right hand upholdeth me.
But those thatseek my soul, to destroy it, Shall go into the lower parts of the earth.
They shall fall by the sword: They shall be a portion for foxes.
But the king shall rejoice in God; Every one that sweareth by him shall glory: But the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.
